STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 15, 2025
Jody Schlaufman
Otsego/Crawford/Oscoda DHHS
931 S OTSEGO AVE,
GAYLORD, MI, 49735-1687
Re: License #: CP690201347
Dear Ms. Schlaufman:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
8/27/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI. 49684
231-383-5531
enclosure
2

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
INTERIM INSPECTION REPORT

GAYLORD, MI 49735-1687

children in foster home, Supervise

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or
parents and the foster parents in the development
of service plans to enable the parent or parents
and foster parents to understand the plan for the
child and the parents' and the foster parent's role
in assisting the agency in carrying out the plan. An
agency shall give a copy to and review the parent-
agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the
information in the parent-agency treatment plan
and any other information about the child and the
child's family is confidential.
Three of eight files reviewed contained one or more PATP's that were signed late.
CPA Rule 400.12422 Foster care case record
• (3) The record must contain all the following
information:
• (g) A photograph taken at least annually.
Three of eight files reviewed did not have updated photos of the children.
2

CPA Rule 400.12505 Supervision
• (2) An agency shall provide the following minimum
supervision:
• (a) Face-to-face contact between the social
service worker and the youth in
independent living at least once each
month at a youth's place of residence.
One of two independent living files contained an in home contact where there was
no narrative describing the visit.
CPA Rule 400.12510 Independent living agreement
• (2) The agreement must be signed and dated by
the youth and the social service worker. The
agreement must be reviewed with the youth at
least once every 90 calendar days and a copy
provided to the youth.
One of two independent files reviewed did not update the independent living
agreement every 90 days.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• The agency was informed DCWL is no longer auditing any DHHS Policy.
DCWL Consultants will only be auditing rules described in the "Licensing
Rules For Child Placing Agencies" rule book.
• The agency was also informed that a social work contact documenting
the foster care worker reviewed the PATP with the foster parent and other
relevant parties and provided them with a copy of the treatment plan
would meet the rule when obtaining signatures was not possible.
• The corrective action plan process was reviewed. It was recommended
that the agency keep a file of action step completion so documents are
ready for review at the three month and six month CAP reviews.
3

V. CONSULTATION
• Consultation was not requested or provided at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency submitted an approved corrective action plan on 8/26/2024 in response to
those violations established during the renewal inspection completed on
7/30/2024. The violations established during the renewal audit are as follows;
1.Rule 400.12502 Program Statement
2. Rule 400.12503 Policy and procedures
3.Rule 400.12510 Independent living agreement
4.Rule 400.12417 Foster Parent Information
5. Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental policy
6. R 400.12418 Development of service plans
7. FOM 722-08D Treatment Plans
8. FOM 801-03 Medical passport
The agency CAP was successful in preventing repeat violations on all violations.
However, the agency was previously cited for not having an agreement and cited
in this interim inspection for not updating the agreement as required.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators Assessment was submitted and reviewed. The
assessment documented the agency supervisors meet with staff regularly to
review the agency CAP and compliance. The assessment speaks to the agency
experiencing a period of development and the agency’s efforts to maintain
compliance with rules and policy. The assessment further reports that regular
review of the CAP assists the agency in maintaining focus on compliance of rules
and policy.
Financial Overview
The agency is a local DHHS office and financial records were not available for
review.
4

Staff Interviews
Staff interviewed reported feeling supported by their supervisors. They each
reported feeling they are part of a high functioning and supportive team. Staff
further reported their supervisors are knowledgeable and are readily available to
help them when problems occur that require supervisory support.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern DHHS facility in Gaylord. There is sufficient
office space for staff and a spacious lobby for serving the public. CHRI documents
are located in the Graying office and were observed to be secured.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst generated three safety alerts during her visits to the homes. They
are as follows:
Safety Alert # 1. The safety alert was generated on 6/16/2025 as the home was
missing a carbon monoxide detector as well as smoke alarms were missing between
the master bedroom and the rest of the home and there was no alarm between the
children's bedroom and the rest of the home.
Resolution: Resolution was achieved on 6/20/2025 as the alarms were installed and
photos provided.
Safety Alert #2. A safety alert was generated on 6/16/2025 as the home did not have a
smoke alarm between sleeping areas and the rest of the home.
Resolution: Resolution was achieved on 6/20/2025 as an alarm was installed and
photos provided.
Safety Alert # 3. A safety alert was generated on 6/16/2025 as the home did not have a
smoke alarm in the basement.
Resolution: Resolution was achieved on 6/20/2025 as a smoke alarm was installed in
the basement and photos were provided.
5

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
September 10, 2025
________________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 15, 2025
________________________________________
Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
